column5: Anybody have any info on this lake?
Yeah, It has lots of water in it!! Just kidding I couldn't resist. I am sure you will get some replies form this board. Good luck!!!

Are you referring to the Clay Lake just north of Vermilion Bay by Eagle Lake? If so, I have fished that lake several times and have done very well on Wallyes with the largest around 8 lbs. Caught plenty of fish and a few Northern Pike. I understand that there are some good large Northerns in the lake. We only fished one end by an access and did not go far from there to find fish.

Fished one day at Clay this year. Weather was tough but it seems to be a good numbers lake. One guy at our camp caught a twelve pound eye while we were in camp. I think North Star Lodge is the camp on the lake. The locals said bad things about the camp, but good things about the lake. Rented a boat from there and found it to be subpar.
I have not fished the lake, but it is my understanding that the fish can not be eaten do to some past pollution problems. Therefore, catch and release, only.
Is this more of a Walleye factory or Pike House?
[font color=green size=3][b]Isn't Clay Lake downstream from the mill in Dryden? The mill has cleaned up it's act in recent years, but are there residual effects for the fish?
I had heard the same thing also about the fish- dont eat them its a polluted lake. I dont know how long it takes for the clean itself up.
